function.name: integrate

description.para: The system function to solve, hence the r.h.s. of the ordinary differential equation.
The initial state.
Start time of the integration.
End time of the integration.
Initial step size, will be adjusted during the integration.
Observer that will be called after each time step.

function.purpose: Integrates the ODE.

description.para: Integrates the ODE given by system from start_time to end_time starting with start_state as initial condition and dt as initial time step. This function uses a dense output dopri5 stepper and performs an adaptive integration with step size control, thus dt changes during the integration. This method uses standard error bounds of 1E-6. After each step, the observer is called.

note.para: A second version of this function template exists which explicitly expects the value type as template parameter, i.e. integrate< double >( sys , x , t0 , t1 , dt , obs );

function.name: integrate

description.para: The system function to solve, hence the r.h.s. of the ordinary differential equation.
The initial state.
Start time of the integration.
End time of the integration.
Initial step size, will be adjusted during the integration.

function.purpose: Integrates the ODE without observer calls.

description.para: Integrates the ODE given by system from start_time to end_time starting with start_state as initial condition and dt as initial time step. This function uses a dense output dopri5 stepper and performs an adaptive integration with step size control, thus dt changes during the integration. This method uses standard error bounds of 1E-6. No observer is called.

note.para: A second version of this function template exists which explicitly expects the value type as template parameter, i.e. integrate< double >( sys , x , t0 , t1 , dt );

function.name: integrate_adaptive

description.para: The stepper to be used for numerical integration.
Function/Functor defining the rhs of the ODE.
The initial condition x0.
The initial time t0.
The final integration time tend.
The time step between observer calls, not necessarily the time step of the integration.
Function/Functor called at equidistant time intervals.

function.purpose: Integrates the ODE with adaptive step size.

description.para: This function integrates the ODE given by system with the given stepper. The observer is called after each step. If the stepper has no error control, the step size remains constant and the observer is called at equidistant time points t0+n*dt. If the stepper is a ControlledStepper, the step size is adjusted and the observer is called in non-equidistant intervals.

function.name: integrate_adaptive
function.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_adaptive
function.purpose: integrate_adaptive without an observer.

function.name: integrate_adaptive
function.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_const

description.para: The stepper to be used for numerical integration.
Function/Functor defining the rhs of the ODE.
The initial condition x0.
The initial time t0.
The final integration time tend.
The time step between observer calls, not necessarily the time step of the integration.
[optional] Function/Functor called at equidistant time intervals.
[optional] Functor to check for step count overflows, if no checker is provided, no exception is thrown.

function.purpose: Integrates the ODE with constant step size.

description.para: Integrates the ODE defined by system using the given stepper. This method ensures that the observer is called at constant intervals dt. If the Stepper is a normal stepper without step size control, dt is also used for the numerical scheme. If a ControlledStepper is provided, the algorithm might reduce the step size to meet the error bounds, but it is ensured that the observer is always called at equidistant time points t0 + n*dt. If a DenseOutputStepper is used, the step size also may vary and the dense output is used to call the observer at equidistant time points. If a max_step_checker is provided as StepOverflowChecker, a no_progress_error is thrown if too many steps (default: 500) are performed without progress, i.e. in between observer calls. If no checker is provided, no such overflow check is performed.

function.name: integrate_const
function.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_const
function.purpose: integrate_const without step overflow checker

function.name: integrate_const
function.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_const
function.purpose: integrate_const without observer calls

function.name: integrate_const
function.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_n_steps
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_n_steps

description.para: The stepper to be used for numerical integration.
Function/Functor defining the rhs of the ODE.
The initial condition x0.
The initial time t0.
The time step between observer calls, not necessarily the time step of the integration.
Number of steps to be performed
Function/Functor called at equidistant time intervals.

function.purpose: The same function as above, but without checker.

description.para: Integrates the ODE with constant step size.

This function is similar to integrate_const. The observer is called at equidistant time intervals t0 + n*dt. If the Stepper is a normal stepper without step size control, dt is also used for the numerical scheme. If a ControlledStepper is provided, the algorithm might reduce the step size to meet the error bounds, but it is ensured that the observer is always called at equidistant time points t0 + n*dt. If a DenseOutputStepper is used, the step size also may vary and the dense output is used to call the observer at equidistant time points. The final integration time is always t0 + num_of_steps*dt. If a max_step_checker is provided as StepOverflowChecker, a no_progress_errror is thrown if too many steps (default: 500) are performed without progress, i.e. in between observer calls. If no checker is provided, no such overflow check is performed.

function.name: integrate_n_steps
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_n_steps
function.purpose: The same function as above, but without observer calls.

function.name: integrate_n_steps
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_times
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_times
function.purpose: The same function as above, but with the observation times given as range.

function.name: integrate_times
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_times

description.para: The stepper to be used for numerical integration.
Function/Functor defining the rhs of the ODE.
The initial condition x0.
Iterator to the start time
Iterator to the end time
The time step between observer calls, not necessarily the time step of the integration.
Function/Functor called at equidistant time intervals.

function.purpose: Integrates the ODE with observer calls at given time points.

description.para: Integrates the ODE given by system using the given stepper. This function does observer calls at the subsequent time points given by the range times_start, times_end. If the stepper has not step size control, the step size might be reduced occasionally to ensure observer calls exactly at the time points from the given sequence. If the stepper is a ControlledStepper, the step size is adjusted to meet the error bounds, but also might be reduced occasionally to ensure correct observer calls. If a DenseOutputStepper is provided, the dense output functionality is used to call the observer at the given times. The end time of the integration is always *(end_time-1). If a max_step_checker is provided as StepOverflowChecker, a no_progress_error is thrown if too many steps (default: 500) are performed without progress, i.e. in between observer calls. If no checker is provided, no such overflow check is performed.

function.name: integrate_times
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

function.name: integrate_times
function.purpose: The same function as above, but with the observation times given as range.

function.name: integrate_times
function.purpose: Solves the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as start_state.

class.name: max_step_checker
class.purpose: A class for performing overflow checks on the step count in integrate functions.

description.para: Provide an instance of this class to integrate functions if you want to throw a runtime error if too many steps are performed without progress during the integrate routine.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Resets the max_step_checker by setting the internal counter to 0.

method.name: operator()
method.purpose: Increases the counter and performs the iteration check.

constructor.purpose: Construct the max_step_checker. max_steps is the maximal number of iterations allowed before runtime_error is thrown.

class.name: failed_step_checker
class.purpose: A class for performing overflow checks on the failed step count in step size adjustments.

description.para: Used internally within the dense output stepper and integrate routines.

method.name: operator()
method.purpose: Increases the counter and performs the iteration check.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Resets the max_step_checker by setting the internal counter to 0.

constructor.purpose: Construct the failed_step_checker. max_steps is the maximal number of iterations allowed before runtime_error is thrown.

class.name: adaptive_iterator

purpose.para: The stepper type which should be used during the iteration.
The type of the system function (ODE) which should be solved.
The state type of the ODE.

class.purpose: ODE Iterator with adaptive step size. The value type of this iterator is the state type of the stepper.

description.para: Implements an iterator representing the solution of an ODE from t_start to t_end evaluated at steps with an adaptive step size dt. After each iteration the iterator dereferences to the state x at the next time t+dt where dt is controlled by the stepper. This iterator can be used with ControlledSteppers and DenseOutputSteppers and it always makes use of the all the given steppers capabilities. A for_each over such an iterator range behaves similar to the integrate_adaptive routine.
adaptive_iterator is a model of single-pass iterator.
The value type of this iterator is the state type of the stepper. Hence one can only access the state and not the current time.

description.para: The stepper to use during the iteration.
The system function (ODE) to solve.
The initial state.
The initial time.
The end time, at which the iteration should stop.
The initial time step.

description.para: Implements an iterator representing the solution of an ODE from t_start to t_end evaluated at steps with an adaptive step size dt. After each iteration the iterator dereferences to a pair containing state and time at the next time point t+dt where dt is controlled by the stepper. This iterator can be used with ControlledSteppers and DenseOutputSteppers and it always makes use of the all the given steppers capabilities. A for_each over such an iterator range behaves similar to the integrate_adaptive routine.
adaptive_iterator is a model of single-pass iterator.
The value type of this iterator is a std::pair of state and time of the stepper.

class.name: times_iterator

purpose.para: The stepper type which should be used during the iteration.
The type of the system function (ODE) which should be solved.
The state type of the ODE.
The iterator type for the sequence of time points.

class.purpose: ODE Iterator with given evaluation points. The value type of this iterator is the state type of the stepper.

description.para: Implements an iterator representing the solution of an ODE from *t_start to *t_end evaluated at time points given by the sequence t_start to t_end. t_start and t_end are iterators representing a sequence of time points where the solution of the ODE should be evaluated. After each iteration the iterator dereferences to the state x at the next time *t_start++ until t_end is reached. This iterator can be used with Steppers, ControlledSteppers and DenseOutputSteppers and it always makes use of the all the given steppers capabilities. A for_each over such an iterator range behaves similar to the integrate_times routine.
times_iterator is a model of single-pass iterator.
The value type of this iterator is the state type of the stepper. Hence one can only access the state and not the current time.

End iterator of the sequence of evaluation time points.
The initial time step.

After each iteration the iterator dereferences to a pair with the state and the time at the next evaluation point *t_start++ until t_end is reached. This iterator can be used with Steppers, ControlledSteppers and DenseOutputSteppers and it always makes use of the all the given steppers capabilities. A for_each over such an iterator range behaves similar to the integrate_times routine.
times_time_iterator is a model of single-pass iterator.
The value type of this iterator is a pair of state and time type.

struct.name: order_helper
struct.inherit: boost::mpl::max::type< mpl::eval_if< mpl::equal_to< mpl::modulus< int_< N >, int_< 2 > >, int_< 0 > >, int_< N >, int_< N+1 > >::type, int_< 4 > >

class.name: adams_bashforth

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

template-type-parameter.name: InitializingStepper
template-type-parameter.default: extrapolation_stepper< order_helper<Steps>::value, State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >

purpose.para: The stepper for the first two steps.

class.purpose: The Adams-Bashforth multistep algorithm.

description.para: The Adams-Bashforth method is a multi-step algorithm with configurable step number. The step number is specified as template parameter Steps and it then uses the result from the previous Steps steps. See also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linear_multistep_method. Currently, a maximum of Steps=8 is supported. The method is explicit and fulfills the Stepper concept. Step size control or continuous output are not provided.
This class derives from algebra_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). For more details see algebra_stepper_base.

method.name: order
method.purpose: Returns the order of the algorithm, which is equal to the number of steps.

method.name: do_step
method.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as StateInOut.

method.name: do_step
method.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as StateOut.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

method.name: step_storage
method.purpose: Returns the storage of intermediate results.

method.name: step_storage

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

template-type-parameter.name: InitializingStepper
template-type-parameter.default: runge_kutta4< State , Value , Deriv , Time , Algebra , Operations, Resizer >

purpose.para: The stepper for the first two steps.

class.purpose: The Adams-Bashforth-Moulton multistep algorithm.

description.para: The Adams-Bashforth method is a multi-step predictor-corrector algorithm with configurable step number. The step number is specified as template parameter Steps and it then uses the result from the previous Steps steps. See also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linear_multistep_method. Currently, a maximum of Steps=8 is supported. The method is explicit and fulfills the Stepper concept. Step size control or continuous output are not provided.
This class derives from algebra_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). For more details see algebra_stepper_base.

method.name: order
method.purpose: Returns the order of the algorithm, which is equal to the number of steps+1.

method.name: do_step
method.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as StateInOut.

method.name: do_step
method.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be called with Boost.Range as StateOut.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Resets the internal buffers of the stepper.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the adams_bashforth class.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the adams_bashforth class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

typedef.name: stepper_type
typedef.type: adams_moulton< Steps, State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >

class.name: bulirsch_stoer

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.purpose: The Bulirsch-Stoer algorithm.

description.para: The Bulirsch-Stoer is a controlled stepper that adjusts both step size and order of the method. The algorithm uses the modified midpoint and a polynomial extrapolation compute the solution.

method.name: try_step
method.purpose: Second version to solve the forwarding problem, can be used with Boost.Range as StateInOut.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Resets the internal state of the stepper.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

description.para: Absolute tolerance level.
Relative tolerance level.
Factor for the weight of the state.
Factor for the weight of the derivative.

class.name: bulirsch_stoer_dense_out

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.purpose: The Bulirsch-Stoer algorithm.

description.para: The Bulirsch-Stoer is a controlled stepper that adjusts both step size and order of the method. The algorithm uses the modified midpoint and a polynomial extrapolation compute the solution. This class also provides dense output facility.

method.name: try_step

description.para: The system function to solve, hence the r.h.s. of the ODE. It must fulfill the Simple System concept.
The state of the ODE which should be solved.
The derivative of state.
The value of the time. Updated if the step is successful.
Used to store the result of the step.
The step size. Updated.

method.purpose: Tries to perform one step.

description.para: This method tries to do one step with step size dt. If the error estimate is to large, the step is rejected and the method returns fail and the step size dt is reduced. If the error estimate is acceptably small, the step is performed, success is returned and dt might be increased to make the steps as large as possible. This method also updates t if a step is performed. Also, the internal order of the stepper is adjusted if required.

returns.para: success if the step was accepted, fail otherwise.

method.name: initialize

description.para: The initial state.
The initial time.
The initial time step.

method.purpose: Initializes the dense output stepper.

method.name: do_step

description.para: The system function to solve, hence the r.h.s. of the ordinary differential equation. It must fulfill the Simple System concept.

method.purpose: Does one time step. This is the main method that should be used to integrate an ODE with this stepper.

note.para: initialize has to be called before using this method to set the initial conditions x,t and the stepsize.

returns.para: Pair with start and end time of the integration step.

method.name: calc_state

description.para: The time at which the solution should be calculated, has to be in the current time interval.
The output variable where the result is written into.

method.purpose: Calculates the solution at an intermediate point within the last step.

method.name: current_state
method.purpose: Returns the current state of the solution.

returns.para: The current state of the solution x(t).

method.name: current_time
method.purpose: Returns the current time of the solution.

returns.para: The current time of the solution t.

method.name: previous_state
method.purpose: Returns the last state of the solution.

returns.para: The last state of the solution x(t-dt).

method.name: previous_time
method.purpose: Returns the last time of the solution.

returns.para: The last time of the solution t-dt.

method.name: current_time_step
method.purpose: Returns the current step size.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Resets the internal state of the stepper.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: Absolute tolerance level.
Relative tolerance level.

Set true to additionally control the error of the interpolation.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the bulirsch_stoer class, including initialization of the error bounds.

class.name: default_error_checker
class.purpose: The default error checker to be used with Runge-Kutta error steppers.

description.para: This class provides the default mechanism to compare the error estimates reported by Runge-Kutta error steppers with user defined error bounds. It is used by the controlled_runge_kutta steppers.

template-type-parameter.name: ErrorChecker
template-type-parameter.default: default_error_checker< typename ErrorStepper::value_type , typename ErrorStepper::algebra_type , typename ErrorStepper::operations_type >

description.para: The system function to solve, hence the r.h.s. of the ODE. It must fulfill the Simple System concept.

The step size. Updated.

method.purpose: Tries to perform one step.

description.para: This method tries to do one step with step size dt. If the error estimate is to large, the step is rejected and the method returns fail and the step size dt is reduced. If the error estimate is acceptably small, the step is performed, success is returned and dt might be increased to make the steps as large as possible. This method also updates t if a step is performed.

returns.para: success if the step was accepted, fail otherwise.

class-specialization.name: dense_output_runge_kutta

purpose.para: The stepper type of the underlying algorithm.

class-specialization.purpose: The class representing dense-output Runge-Kutta steppers.

description.para: In this stepper, the initialize method has to be called before using the do_step method. The dense-output functionality allows to interpolate the solution between subsequent integration points using intermediate results obtained during the computation. This version works based on a normal stepper without step-size control.

method.name: initialize

description.para: The initial state of the ODE which should be solved.
The initial time, at which the step should be performed.
The step size.

class.name: euler

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.purpose: An implementation of the Euler method.

description.para: The Euler method is a very simply solver for ordinary differential equations. This method should not be used for real applications. It is only useful for demonstration purposes. Step size control is not provided but trivial continuous output is available.
This class derives from explicit_stepper_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern), see explicit_stepper_base

method.name: do_step_impl

description.para: The state of the ODE which should be solved. in is not modified in this method
The derivative of x at t.
The result of the step is written in out.
The step size.

method.purpose: This method performs one step. The derivative dxdt of in at the time t is passed to the method. The result is updated out of place, hence the input is in in and the output in out. Access to this step functionality is provided by explicit_stepper_base and do_step_impl should not be called directly.

method.name: calc_state
method.purpose: This method is used for continuous output and it calculates the state x at a time t from the knowledge of two states old_state and current_state at time points t_old and t_new.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the euler class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor of the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: explicit_error_generic_rk

purpose.para: The number of stages of the Runge-Kutta algorithm.
The order of a stepper if the stepper is used without error estimation.
The order of a step if the stepper is used with error estimation. Usually Order and StepperOrder have the same value.
The order of the error step if the stepper is used with error estimation.
The type representing the state of the ODE.
The floating point type which is used in the computations.
The type representing the independent variable - the time - of the ODE.

class.purpose: A generic implementation of explicit Runge-Kutta algorithms with error estimation. This class is as a base class for all explicit Runge-Kutta steppers with error estimation.

description.para: This class implements the explicit Runge-Kutta algorithms with error estimation in a generic way. The Butcher tableau is passed to the stepper which constructs the stepper scheme with the help of a template-metaprogramming algorithm. ToDo : Add example!
This class derives explicit_error_stepper_base which provides the stepper interface.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: Triangular matrix of parameters b in the Butcher tableau.
Last row of the butcher tableau.
Parameters for lower-order evaluation to estimate the error.
Parameters to calculate the time points in the Butcher tableau.
A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

The type representing the independent variable - the time - of the ODE.

class.name: extrapolation_stepper
class.purpose: Extrapolation stepper with configurable order, and error estimation.

description.para: The extrapolation stepper is a stepper with error estimation and configurable order. The order is given as template parameter and needs to be an odd number. The stepper is based on several executions of the modified midpoint method and a Richardson extrapolation. This is essentially the same technique as for bulirsch_stoer, but without the variable order.

note.para: The Order parameter has to be an even number greater 2.

description.para: Implementation of the modified midpoint method with a configurable number of intermediate steps. This class is used by the Bulirsch-Stoer algorithm and is not meant for direct usage.

typedef.name: stepper_base_type
typedef.type: explicit_stepper_base< modified_midpoint< State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >, 2, State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >

description.para:
Implementation of the modified midpoint method with a configurable number of intermediate steps. This class is used by the dense output Bulirsch-Stoer algorithm and is not meant for direct usage.
This stepper is for internal use only and does not meet any stepper concept.

typedef.name: stepper_type
typedef.type: modified_midpoint_dense_out< State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >

class.name: runge_kutta4

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.inherit: boost::numeric::odeint::explicit_generic_rk< StageCount, Order, State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >
class.purpose: The classical Runge-Kutta stepper of fourth order.

description.para: The Runge-Kutta method of fourth order is one standard method for solving ordinary differential equations and is widely used, see also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge-Kutta_methods The method is explicit and fulfills the Stepper concept. Step size control or continuous output are not provided.

This class derives from explicit_stepper_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). Furthermore, it derivs from explicit_generic_rk which is a generic Runge-Kutta algorithm. For more details see explicit_stepper_base and explicit_generic_rk.

class.purpose: The classical Runge-Kutta stepper of fourth order.

description.para: The Runge-Kutta method of fourth order is one standard method for solving ordinary differential equations and is widely used, see also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runge-Kutta_methods The method is explicit and fulfills the Stepper concept. Step size control or continuous output are not provided. This class implements the method directly, hence the generic Runge-Kutta algorithm is not used.
This class derives from explicit_stepper_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). For more details see explicit_stepper_base.

method.name: do_step_impl

description.para: The system function to solve, hence the r.h.s. of the ODE. It must fulfill the Simple System concept.
The state of the ODE which should be solved. in is not modified in this method
The derivative of x at t.
The value of the time, at which the step should be performed.
The result of the step is written in out.
The step size.

method.purpose: This method performs one step. The derivative dxdt of in at the time t is passed to the method. The result is updated out of place, hence the input is in in and the output in out. Access to this step functionality is provided by explicit_stepper_base and do_step_impl should not be called directly.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the runge_kutta4_classic class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: runge_kutta_cash_karp54

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.inherit: boost::numeric::odeint::explicit_error_generic_rk< StageCount, Order, StepperOrder, ErrorOrder, State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >
class.purpose: The Runge-Kutta Cash-Karp method.

description.para: The Runge-Kutta Cash-Karp method is one of the standard methods for solving ordinary differential equations, see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cash-Karp_methods. The method is explicit and fulfills the Error Stepper concept. Step size control is provided but continuous output is not available for this method.

This class derives from explicit_error_stepper_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). Furthermore, it derivs from explicit_error_generic_rk which is a generic Runge-Kutta algorithm with error estimation. For more details see explicit_error_stepper_base and explicit_error_generic_rk.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the runge_kutta_cash_karp54 class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: runge_kutta_cash_karp54_classic

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.purpose: The Runge-Kutta Cash-Karp method implemented without the generic Runge-Kutta algorithm.

description.para: The Runge-Kutta Cash-Karp method is one of the standard methods for solving ordinary differential equations, see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cash-Karp_method. The method is explicit and fulfills the Error Stepper concept. Step size control is provided but continuous output is not available for this method.

This class derives from explicit_error_stepper_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). This class implements the method directly, hence the generic Runge-Kutta algorithm is not used.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the runge_kutta_cash_karp54_classic class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: runge_kutta_dopri5

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.purpose: The Runge-Kutta Dormand-Prince 5 method.

description.para: The Runge-Kutta Dormand-Prince 5 method is a very popular method for solving ODEs, see . The method is explicit and fulfills the Error Stepper concept. Step size control is provided but continuous output is available which make this method favourable for many applications.

This class derives from explicit_error_stepper_fsal_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). The method possesses the FSAL (first-same-as-last) property. See explicit_error_stepper_fsal_base for more details.

method.name: calc_state
method.purpose: This method is used for continuous output and it calculates the state x at a time t from the knowledge of two states old_state and current_state at time points t_old and t_new. It also uses internal variables to calculate the result. Hence this method must be called after two successful do_step calls.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the runge_kutta_dopri5 class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: runge_kutta_fehlberg78

purpose.para: The type representing the time derivative of the state.
The time representing the independent variable - the time.

class.inherit: boost::numeric::odeint::explicit_error_generic_rk< StageCount, Order, StepperOrder, ErrorOrder, State, Value, Deriv, Time, Algebra, Operations, Resizer >
class.purpose: The Runge-Kutta Fehlberg 78 method.

description.para: The Runge-Kutta Fehlberg 78 method is a standard method for high-precision applications. The method is explicit and fulfills the Error Stepper concept. Step size control is provided but continuous output is not available for this method.

This class derives from explicit_error_stepper_base and inherits its interface via CRTP (current recurring template pattern). Furthermore, it derivs from explicit_error_generic_rk which is a generic Runge-Kutta algorithm with error estimation. For more details see explicit_error_stepper_base and explicit_error_generic_rk.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the runge_kutta_cash_fehlberg78 class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: symplectic_euler

purpose.para: The type representing the coordinates q.
The type representing the coordinates p.
The basic value type. Should be something like float, double or a high-precision type.
The type representing the time derivative of the coordinate dq/dt.
The type representing the time t.

class.purpose: Implementation of the symplectic Euler method.

description.para: The method is of first order and has one stage. It is described HERE.
A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the symplectic_euler. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

The type representing the coordinates p.
The basic value type. Should be something like float, double or a high-precision type.
The type representing the time derivative of the coordinate dq/dt.
The type representing the time t.

class.purpose: Implementation of the symmetric B3A Runge-Kutta Nystroem method of fifth order.

description.para: The method is of fourth order and has five stages. It is described HERE. This method can be used with multiprecision types since the coefficients are defined analytically.
ToDo: add reference to paper.
A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the symplectic_rkn_sb3a_m4_mclachlan. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: symplectic_rkn_sb3a_mclachlan

purpose.para: The type representing the coordinates q.
The type representing the coordinates p.
The basic value type. Should be something like float, double or a high-precision type.
The type representing the time derivative of the coordinate dq/dt.
The type representing the time t.

class.purpose: Implement of the symmetric B3A method of Runge-Kutta-Nystroem method of sixth order.

description.para: The method is of fourth order and has six stages. It is described HERE. This method cannot be used with multiprecision types since the coefficients are not defined analytically.
ToDo Add reference to the paper.
A copy of algebra is made and stored inside explicit_stepper_base.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the symplectic_rkn_sb3a_mclachlan. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.

class.name: velocity_verlet

purpose.para: The time representing the independent variable - the time.
The time representing the square of the time.

class.purpose: The Velocity-Verlet algorithm.

description.para: The Velocity-Verlet algorithm is a method for simulation of molecular dynamics systems. It solves the ODE a=f(r,v',t) where r are the coordinates, v are the velocities and a are the accelerations, hence v = dr/dt, a=dv/dt.

returns.para: Returns the order of the stepper.

method.name: adjust_size

description.para: A state from which the size of the temporaries to be resized is deduced.

method.purpose: Adjust the size of all temporaries in the stepper manually.

method.name: reset
method.purpose: Resets the internal state of this stepper. After calling this method it is safe to use all do_step method without explicitly initializing the stepper.

returns.para: Returns if the stepper is initialized.

description.para: A copy of algebra is made and stored.

constructor.purpose: Constructs the velocity_verlet class. This constructor can be used as a default constructor if the algebra has a default constructor.
